titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Center for Pacific Northwest Studies slides 1975-1989
Center for Pacific Northwest Studies slides
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Joseph Shay

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Joseph Shay 2011
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS ( Describing Archives: A Content Standard).

did.unittitle: Center for Pacific Northwest Studies slides
did.abstract: The collection consists of several sets of slides covering events sponsored by CPNWS.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of several sets of slides covering the following events sponsored by CPNWS: the People of the Cedar exhibit; the Lieutenant Warre exhibit; Paul Kane drawings; Fort Vancouver in 1846; Coast Artillery including images of Ft. Casey on Whidbey Island and Ft. Warden at Port Townsend; and the move of the Bellingham Bay Improvement Company records from downtown Bellingham to CPNWS. Although the slides were taken at events in the 1970s and 1980s, some of the images depict documents that date much earlier.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to the public.

prefercite.p: Center for Pacific Northwest Studies, Western Libraries Archives & Special Collections, Western Washington University, Bellingham WA 98225-9123.

processinfo.head: About Harmful Language and Content
processinfo.p: To learn more about problematic content in our collections, collection description and teaching tools (including how to provide feedback or request dialogue on this topic), see the following Statement About Potentially Harmful Language and Content

acqinfo.p: Created and/or collected by the Center for Pacific Northwest Studies, circa 1975-1989.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.

controlaccess.corpname: Western Washington University--Center for Pacific Northwest Studies

dsc.p: The following section contains a detailed listing of the materials in the collection.

did.unittitle: Moving the Bellingham Bay Improvement Company records from downtown to Western Washington University (38 Slides)
Fort Vancouver in the mid 19th century. Slides obtained from the Hudson’s Bay Company Archives, Manitoba (2 slides)
Paintings by Paul Kane regarding Pacific Northwest topics. Slides obtained from the Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto (20 slides)
Slides taken during the exhibition of Lieutenant Warre’s drawings and sketches in the Map Library, WWU (102 slides)
Coastal Artillery Placements with detailed descriptions. Images include Fort Casey on Whidbey Island and Fort Warden in Port Townsend, circa 1900-24, 1960-1970s (15 slides)
Canadian Exhibition “People of the Cedar” at Western Washington University’s Map Library (50 slides)
